Hey!

Rohan Sikand üå≤

rsikand@stanford.edu


Hey, I'm Rohan! I'm a student at The Farm studying Computer Science with interests in software development, machine learning, computer systems, and mathematics. This is my personal home page where I keep a portfolio of my research, projects, and other things like notes, and a blog. Most my work is on my Github. In my free time, I enjoy playing spikeball, golfing, and serving ping pong balls.

Research

My research interests include deep learning and its applications to fields such as computer vision and medicine.
Registration of the T2 and DWI b1200 MRI Sequences of the Prostate
Participated in the Canary CREST research program at Stanford Medicine (Urologic Cancer Innovation Lab). There, I conducted a research project involving the registration of the T2 and DWI b1200 MRI Sequences of the Prostate using classical and deep learning methods.
Skills: PyTorch, computer vision, deformable fields, neural networks, affine transformations
[paper] [poster] [code]
Stanford ACMLab Projects
Applying ML concepts to projects with peers.
(1): ‚ÄùMapping Income Distribution with Machine Learning‚Äù (link).
(2): Developed benchmark tests for large language models: ‚ÄùLogic grid puzzles‚Äù. Publication: RG, WZ, RS, JK, EC, JT (2021). WELM@ICLR (Spotlight).
(3) Using language models for detecting patronizing and condescending language for the SemEval 2022 workshop (task).
Skills: PyTorch, Tensorflow, sklearn, neural networks, deep learning
LSTMs and Fully-Connected Dense Neural Networks for speech classification in sleep sounds.
During my first year at Stanford, I was a research intern in the Mignot Lab at Stanford School of Medicine. I conducted a project involving the use of sequence-based deep learning architectures, such as Long short-term memory networks, to classify sleep sounds via mel spectogram representations of audio waves.
Skills: Keras, Tensorflow, Librosa, neural networks
[code]

Projects

Basically my Github repo's.
Probabilistic Methods for Diagnosing Parkinson‚Äôs Disease in Hand-Drawn Spirals
CS 109 project. Modeled curvature in hand-drawn spirals as Gaussian distributions for inference: a heuristic for diagnosing Parkinson‚Äôs disease (selected as CS 109 challenge winner).
[Paper] [Video] [Slides]
Deep Learning for Classifying Subcellular Patterns of Proteins in Microscopic Images
CS 279 final project.
[Code] [Paper]
Lemnos: CLI To-do List Manager
An open source light-weight command-line to-do list manager. Used Python, Unix.
Heap Allocator
CS 107 final project. Designed and implemented implicit and explicit free list allocators for dynamic memory allocation (implemented core memory functions malloc, realloc, and free). Used C, x86 Assembly.
Random Username Generator
A simple program that generates random usernames wrapped in a Flask app. Used Python, HTML, CSS, Javascript.
Brain Tumor Segmentation using Traditional Programming
Program that segments brain tumors in MRI scans through procedural programming‚Äìrequires no training data. Used Python, Pillow.
